required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Non-interventional Study of REVLIMID® (Lenalidomide) Treatment of IPSS Low- or Intermediate-1-risk Myelodysplastic Syndromes Associated With a Deletion 5q or Refractory/Relapsed Mantle Cell Lymphoma in Korea
clinical_study.official_title: Post Marketing Surveillance on Safety Evaluation of REVLIMID® (Lenalidomide) Treatment of Myelodysplastic Syndromes Associated With a Deletion 5q or Mantle Cell Lymphoma in Korea

brief_summary.textblock:
The Drug Use Examination (DUE) is planned and designed for the safety evaluation of new indications after the approval of a new drug in Korea.
This DUE is a non-interventional, observational and post-marketing surveillance, which will be conducted by collecting the safety information of REVLIMID® for new indications in routine clinical practice in Korea.
Six-Hundred (600) adult patients, who start with REVLIMID® treatment based on the approved local package insert (PI) of REVLIMID® during routine clinical practice in Korea and have indications noted below.
1. Patients with transfusion-dependent anemia due to IPSS low- or intermediate-1-risk Myelodysplastic Syndromes associated with a deletion 5q cytogenetic abnormality (del [5q] MDS)
2. Patients with mantle cell lymphoma who have received at least one prior therapy (rrMCL)
3. Previously treated follicular lymphoma (FL), in combination with rituximab (an anti-CD20 antibody)

primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until at least 28 days after completion of study treatment
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with adverse event

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until at least 28 days after completion of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effectiveness of REVLIMID® treatment in patients with IPSS low- or intermediate-1-risk del (5q) MDS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 years of Revlimid treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Effectiveness evaluation for IPSS low- or intermediate-1-risk del (5q) MDS is RBC transfusion-independence response rate for ≥ 56 days (8 weeks) in patients who receive at least 2 cycles of Revlimid

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effectiveness of REVLIMID® treatment in patients with rrMCL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 years of Revlimid treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Effectiveness evaluation for refractory/relapsed Mantle Cell Lymphoma (rrMCL) is Overall Response Rate up to 6 cycles assessed by the investigators using the Cheson Criteria, 1999

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effectiveness of REVLIMID® treatment in patients with previously treated FL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 4 years of Revlimid treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Effectiveness evaluation for refractory/relapsed previously treated FL is Overall Response Rate up to 6 cycles assessed by the investigators per 2007 International Working Group criteria.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Lenalidomide in IPSS Low-or intermediate-1-risk del population
arm_group.description: For the IPSS Low- or intermediate-1-risk del (5q) (MDS), Lenalidomide treatment must not be started if the ANC < 0.5 x 109/L and/or platelet counts < 25 x 109/L. The recommended starting dose of lenalidomide is 10 mg orally once daily on days 1 to 21 of repeated 28-day cycles.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Lenalidomide in Refractory/relapsed rrMC/ Follicular lymphoma population
arm_group.description: For the Refractory/relapsed Mantle cell lymphoma (rrMCL), the recommended starting dose of lenalidomide is 25 mg orally once daily on days 1 to 21 of repeated 28-day cycles. For the Follicular lymphoma (FL), the recommended starting dose of rituximab is 375 mg/m2 intravenously (IV) every week in Cycle 1 (days 1, 8, 15, and 22) and day 1 of every 28-day cycle for Cycles 2 through 5.

intervention.arm_group_label: Lenalidomide in IPSS Low-or intermediate-1-risk del population
Lenalidomide in Refractory/relapsed rrMC/ Follicular lymphoma population

study_pop.textblock: Six-Hundred (600) adult patients, who start with REVLIMID® treatment based on the approved local package insert (PI) of REVLIMID® during routine clinical practice in Korea and have indications noted for IPSS low- or intermediate-1-risk del (5q) MDS, rrMCL and previously treated Follicular lymphoma.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Treatment of patients with transfusion-dependent anemia due to IPSS low- or intermediate-1-risk Myelodysplastic Syndromes associated with a deletion 5q cytogenetic abnormality according to International scoring system for evaluating prognosis in myelodysplastic syndromes according to IPSS or
- Treatment of patients with mantle cell lymphoma who have received at least one prior therapy
- Previously treated follicular lymphoma (FL)
- Patients who are registered in Celgene Risk Management Program" in Korea
Exclusion Criteria:
Pregnancy or females of childbearing potential
- Hypersensitivity to the active substance or to any of the excipients (e.g., angioedema, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis, DRESS)
- Patients with genetic disorder (e.g., galactose intolerance, Lapp lactase deficiency, or glucose-galactose malabsorption)

facility.name: Naitonal Health Insurance Service Ilsan hospital
The Catholic University, St. Mary's Hospital

clinical_study.keyword: Relapsed and Refractory Mantle cell lymphoma
IPSS Low- or intermediate-1-risk Myelodysplastic Syndromes Associated with a deletion 5q
previously treated follicular lymphoma (FL) in Korea
